org.epochx.gp.op.init
Class GrowInitialiser

java.lang.Object
  org.epochx.op.ConfigOperator<GPModel>
      org.epochx.gp.op.init.GrowInitialiser
All Implemented Interfaces:
GPInitialiser, ConfigListener, Listener, Initialiser, Operator
public class GrowInitialiser
extends ConfigOperator<GPModel>
implements GPInitialiser

Initialisation implementation which randomly grows program trees down to a maximum depth.

If a model is provided then the following parameters are loaded upon every configure event:

  • population size
  • maximum initial program depth
  • syntax
  • random number generator

If the getModel method returns null then no model is set and whatever static parameters have been set as parameters to the constructor or using the standard accessor methods will be used. If any compulsory parameters remain unset when the initialiser is requested to generate new programs, then an IllegalStateException will be thrown.

See Also:
FullInitialiser, RampedHalfAndHalfInitialiser

GrowInitialiser

public GrowInitialiser(GPModel model)
Constructs a GrowInitialiser with the necessary parameters loaded from the given model. The parameters are reloaded on configure events. Duplicate programs are allowed in the populations that are constructed.

Parameters:
model - the GPModel instance from which the necessary parameters should be loaded.

GrowInitialiser

                       boolean acceptDuplicates)
Constructs a GrowInitialiser with the necessary parameters loaded from the given model. The parameters are reloaded on configure events.

Parameters:
model - the GPModel instance from which the necessary parameters should be loaded.
acceptDuplicates - whether duplicates should be allowed in the populations that are generated.

onConfigure

Specified by:

Overrides:
onConfigure in class ConfigOperator<GPModel>

getInitialPopulation

public java.util.List<CandidateProgram> getInitialPopulation()
Generates a population of new GPCandidatePrograms constructed from the Nodes in the syntax attribute. The size of the population will be equal to the population size attribute. All programs in the population are only guarenteed to be unique (as defined by the equals method on GPCandidateProgram) if the isDuplicatesEnabled method returns false. Each program will have a node tree with a depth at most equal to the value of the maximum depth attribute.

Specified by:
getInitialPopulation in interface GPInitialiser
Specified by:
getInitialPopulation in interface Initialiser
Returns:
A List of newly generated GPCandidatePrograms.

getInitialProgram

public GPCandidateProgram getInitialProgram()
Grows a new node tree and returns it within a GPCandidateProgram. The nodes that form the tree will be randomly selected from the nodes provided as the syntax attribute.

Returns:
a new GPCandidateProgram instance.

getGrownNodeTree

public Node getGrownNodeTree(int maxDepth)
Builds a grown node tree with a maximum depth as given. The nodes that form the tree will be randomly selected from the nodes provided as the syntax attribute.

Parameters:
maxDepth - The maximum depth of the node tree to be grown, where the depth is the number of nodes from the root.
Returns:
The root node of a randomly generated node tree.

isDuplicatesEnabled

public boolean isDuplicatesEnabled()
Returns whether or not duplicates are currently accepted or rejected from generated populations.

Returns:
true if duplicates are currently accepted in any populations generated by the getInitialPopulation method and false otherwise

Parameters:

setRNG

public void setRNG(RandomNumberGenerator rng)
Sets the random number generator to use. If a model has been set then this parameter will be overwritten with the random number generator from that model on the next configure event.

Parameters:
rng - the random number generator to set.

getSyntax

public java.util.List<Node> getSyntax()
Returns a List of the Nodes that form the syntax of new program generated with this initialiser, or an empty list if none have been set.

Returns:
the types of Node that should be used in constructing new programs.

setSyntax

public void setSyntax(java.util.List<Node> syntax)
Sets the Nodes that should be used to construct new programs. If a model has been set then this parameter will be overwritten with the syntax from that model on the next configure event.

Parameters:
syntax - a List of the types of Node that should be used in constructing new programs.

getReturnType

public java.lang.Class<?> getReturnType()
Gets the return type of the program trees that are generated with this initialiser. For a program to have a specific return type means that its root node should return an instance of the given type.

Returns:
the return type of the programs being generated.

setReturnType

public void setReturnType(java.lang.Class<?> returnType)
Sets the return type of the program trees that are generated with this initialiser. For a program to have a specific return type means that is root node will return an instance of the given type.

Parameters:
returnType - the return type that generated programs should have.

getPopSize

public int getPopSize()
Returns the size of the populations that this initialiser constructs or -1 if none has been set.

Returns:
the size of the populations that this initialiser will generate.

setPopSize

public void setPopSize(int popSize)
Sets the size of the populations that this initialiser should construct on calls to the getInitialPopulation method.

Parameters:
popSize - the size of the populations that should be created by this initialiser.

getMaxDepth

Returns the depth that every program generated by this initialiser should have.

the maximum depth the program trees constructed should be.
